thread.title: By The Numbers: Nicki Minaj Vs. Remy Ma
thread.title_full: By The Numbers: Nicki Minaj Vs. Remy Ma

author: Victoria Hernandez
title: By The Numbers: Nicki Minaj Vs. Remy Ma
text:
By The Numbers: Nicki Minaj Vs. Remy Ma March 4, 2017 | 9:28 AM 63 
Remy Ma torched the Hip Hop landscape this week with her “SHETHER” and “Another One” diss tracks slathering all sorts of insults on Nicki Minaj. 
Her use of Nas’“Ether” instrumental is debatable , and so is the question of whether Nicki even cares enough to respond to the seven-minute onslaught. 
Judging by Nicki’s Instagram feed since the tracks dropped, she seems to be going about business as usual. A post shared by Nicki Minaj (@nickiminaj) on Feb 27, 2017 at 2:24pm PST A post shared by Nicki Minaj (@nickiminaj) on Feb 28, 2017 at 10:10am PST A post shared by Nicki Minaj (@nickiminaj) on Mar 2, 2017 at 1:35pm PST Is Nicki fronting trying to act carefree while penning her own response? Only time will only tell. But one thing we do know for sure is that numbers don’t lie. Both the Queens rapper and BX Bomber have had various levels of success either commercially or in the streets. Remy Ma is only two years Nicki’s elder (36 vs. 34), although her track record might make her seem more of an OG than her pop-friendly rival. But they have both had significant milestones throughout their careers. Let’s break it down: Number of Solo Placements on Hot 100 Embed from Getty Images Remy Ma – 1 (she hit #90 with “Conceited” in 2006) Nicki Minaj – 25 (Here are all her hits, listed with their highest chart placement: #2 “Anaconda,” #3 “Super Bass,” #5 “Starships,” #12 “Only,” #13 “Moment 4 Life,” #14 “Truffle Butter,” #14 “Your Love,” #15 “Pound the Alarm,” #19 “Fly,” #22 “Va Va Voom,” #24 “Pills N Potions,” #26 “Right Thru Me,” #31 “The Night is Still Young,” #39 “Feeling Myself,” #48 “Beez In The Trap,” #49 “Did It On Em,” #51 “Right By My Side,” #56 “Roman’s Revenge,” #59 “Stupid Hoe,” #62 “Bed of Lies,” #64 “High School,” #64 “Roman in Moscow,” #64 “Black Barbies,” #70 “Roman Reloaded,” #88 “Get on Your Knees” Highest Billboard 200 Chart Placement 
Remy Ma – #33 There’s Something About Remy: Based On A True Story (2006) 
Nicki Minaj – #1 (2x) Pink Friday (2010) and Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded (2012) Number of RIAA Certifications Embed from Getty Images Remy Ma – 1: “All the Way Up” Platinum Nicki Minaj – 21: Ariana Grande’s “Side to Side” Platinum, Trey Songz’s “Touchin, Lovin” Gold, Pink Friday album 3x Platinum, Pink Friday: Roman Reloaded album 2x Platinum, The Pinkprint album 2x Platinum, David Guetta’s “Hey Mama” 2x Platinum, “The Night is Still Young” Platinum, Jessie J’s “Bang Bang” 5x Platinum, “Only” 3x Platinum, “Anaconda” 2x Platinum, “Starships” 6x Platinum, “Super Bass” 8x Platinum, “High School” Gold, “Pound the Alarm” Platinum, “Beez in the Trap” Gold, “Did It On ‘Em” Gold, “Fly” Platinum, Sean Kingston’s “Letting Go” Platinum, “Moment 4 Life” Platinum, “Right Thru Me” Gold, “Your Love” Platinum Most-Watched Solo YouTube Video Remy Ma – “Conceited (There’s Something About Remy)” (4,739,592 views) Nicki Minaj – “Anaconda” (660,187,675 views) Number of Grammy Nominations Embed from Getty Images Remy Ma – 2: Best Rap Song (“All the Way Up,” 2017) Best Rap Performance (“All the Way Up,” 2017) Nicki Minaj – 10: Best Rap Album ( The Pinkprint, 2016), Best Rap Performance (“Truffle Butter,” 2016), Best Rap/Sung Collaboration (“Only,” 2016), Best Rap Song (“Anaconda,” 2015), Best Pop Duo/Group Performance (“Bang Bang,” 2015), Album of the Year (Appearance on Rihanna’s Loud , 2012), Best New Artist (2012), Best Rap Album ( Pink Friday , 2012), Best Rap Performance (“Moment 4 Life,” 2012), Best Rap Performance by a Duo or Group (Ludacris’“My Chick Bad,” 2011) Number of BET Best Female Hip Hop Artist Awards
